intro: Corydalis crassirhizomata, commonly known as the thick-rooted corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant produces vibrant purple or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water and nutrients in its native arid environments. Corydalis crassirhizomata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some Asian countries.
